img.h1: THE LATEST - Messages from Dr. Whitbeck

br.br:
Dear Bryan ISD Parents/Guardians,
This afternoon Governor Abbott declared that all Texas school campuses will remain closed for the remainder of the school year. While this is disappointing, because more than anything we wanted to see our students back in their classrooms this year, I hope this measure will allow our community to overcome this virus and heal so we can start the next school year as normal in August.
This decision means that it is now even more important that your children engage in online learning. Approximately 90% of our students are using Schoology since we began this new system on April 6, 2020. That is a testament to what you’re doing at home. Thank you! We need this to continue as this will be our reality for the 6th Six Weeks of the 2019-2020 school year. The assignments that are posted in Schoology are required, and they will determine your child's grade for the 6th Six Weeks.
I also want to strongly encourage you to make sure your child is engaging with their teachers online. All Bryan ISD teachers are holding regular online office hours. They are there to provide instruction and answer any questions from you or your children. You can message them through Schoology and they are available for live Google Hangout video conferencing, too.
We check daily to see which students have logged on to Schoology and have completed assignments, and which students have not. Teachers are reaching out to students and parents if a child has not completed assignments or participated, so if you see a phone call from an unknown phone number, that may be your child's teacher. I understand that everyone’s situation is different, and that is why we are practicing “grace before grades”. Our staff will work with you individually with any hardships you are facing. It is important that all of our students finish this school year strong.
Through feedback we’ve received, we know most families have a computer and internet at home now. Thank you to everyone who came and picked up a Chromebook. I know some of you waited in long lines. If you do not have a laptop at home, please contact our Technology Department as soon as possible by completing this survey. You may also contact the Help Desk at 979-209-1175 or through email at BISD_helpdesk@bryanisd.org. We need to make sure you have a computer at home so your child does not fall behind in these final five weeks of school. Should you need Internet access, please review the options detailed on our website.
Finally, I know this adds even more uncertainty for our Class of 2020. Senior parents are aware that we have had several communications just to our seniors as they are uniquely affected by school closure. Two alternates dates have been determined for outdoor graduations and we are finalizing more information. Please expect a separate communication early next week with more details about prom and other events.
Thank you, once again, for everything you’ve done to get your child online and learning. It is remarkable to already have such a high percentage of Bryan ISD students engaged in Schoology, working with their teachers, and turning in assignments. Please remember we are here should your children need emotional support during this time. Please stay safe. We cherish our children in BISD and their families.
Sincerely,
Dr. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendent
---
17 de abril de 2020
Estimados Padres/Tutores del Distrito de Bryan:
Esta tarde el Gobernador Abbott declaró que todos los planteles escolares de Texas permanecerán cerrados por el resto del ciclo escolar. Esto es decepcionante, ya que más que nada queríamos ver a nuestros estudiantes de regreso en sus salones de clase este año. Espero que esta medida permita a nuestra comunidad superar este virus y curarse para que podamos empezar el próximo ciclo escolar con normalidad en agosto.
Esta decisión significa que ahora es aún más importante que sus hijos participen en el aprendizaje en línea. Aproximadamente el 90% de nuestros estudiantes están usando Schoology desde que iniciamos este nuevo sistema el 6 de abril de 2020. Ese es un testimonio de lo que están haciendo en casa. ¡Gracias! Necesitamos que esto continúe ya que esta será nuestra realidad para las 6as Seis Semanas del ciclo escolar 2019-2020. Las asignaciones que se publican en Schoology son obligatorias, y determinarán la calificación de su hijo para las 6as Seis Semanas.
También quiero recomendarles que se aseguren de que sus hijos participen con sus maestros en línea. Todos los maestros del Distrito de Bryan tienen un horario escolar en línea. Están allí para ofrecer instrucción y responder a cualquier pregunta de ustedes o de sus hijos. Pueden enviarles mensajes a través de Schoology y también están disponibles para una videoconferencia en directo con Google Hangout video.
Revisamos diariamente para ver qué estudiantes se han conectado a Schoology y han completado sus asignaciones y quienes no lo han hecho. Los maestros se comunican con los estudiantes y los padres si un niño no ha completado las asignaciones o no ha participado, así que si ven una llamada telefónica de un número desconocido, puede ser el maestro de su hijo. Entiendo que la situación de cada uno es diferente, y es por eso que estamos practicando “comprensión antes de calificar”. Nuestro personal trabajará con ustedes individualmente con cualquier dificultad que estén enfrentando. Es importante que todos nuestros estudiantes terminen este año escolar con mucha fuerza.
A través de la información que hemos recibido, sabemos que ya la mayoría de las familias tienen una computadora y servicio de internet en el hogar. Agradecemos a todos los que han pasado a recoger una tableta Chromebook. Estoy consciente de que muchos de ustedes han esperado en largas líneas. Si no tienen una computadora en casa, favor de comunicarse al Departamento de Tecnología lo antes posible completando esta encuesta. También pueden comunicarse al Servicio de Asistencia Técnica al 979-209-1175 o por correo electrónico a BISD_helpdesk@bryanisd.org. Necesitamos estar seguros de que tienen una computadora en casa para que su hijo no se atrase durante estas cinco semanas finales del ciclo escolar. Si necesitan tener acceso al internet favor de revisar las opciones disponibles en nuestra página web.
Finalmente, sé que esto añade aún más incertidumbre a nuestro grupo de la Generación de 2020. Los padres de los estudiantes que son candidatos a graduación saben que hemos tenido comunicación con nuestros graduandos solamente ya que ellos son afectados de una forma única con el cierre escolar. Hemos establecido dos fechas alternas para una graduación al aire libre y estamos finalizando los detalles y la información. Recibirán otra nota informativa a principios de la próxima semana con relación al baile de graduación y a otros eventos.
Gracias, una vez más, por todo lo que han hecho para que sus hijos estén aprendiendo en línea. Es admirable el tener un porcentaje tan alto de estudiantes en el Distrito Escolar de Bryan activamente participando en Schoology, trabajando con sus maestros y entregando sus tareas. Recuerden que estamos aquí si sus hijos necesitan apoyo emocional durante este tiempo. Por favor manténganse seguros. Estimamos a nuestros niños en el distrito escolar de Bryan y a sus familias.
Sinceramente,
Dra. Christie Whitbeck
Superintendente - Distrito Escolar de Bryan

Dear Bryan ISD Parents/Guardians,
I hope the first day of online learning with Schoology went well. This is new for all of us, and there will be some bumps this week and beyond. But, this is the best way to ensure our students are still working with their teachers, and receiving an excellent education, even as they stay away from the campus. If you have a great picture of your student/child learning at home, please email it to info@bryanisd.org. We would love to capture how our amazing students are adapting.
While these assignments are mandatory and will be graded, something we’re embracing around Bryan ISD is “grace before grades.” We know everyone’s situation is different, and no one’s situation is perfect. That’s why students can work on these assignments anytime during the week, and just need to turn them in by the end of each week. If students have any questions, please make sure they are talking with their teachers through Schoology during the teacher’s “office time.” Teachers may be reaching out to families so don’t hang up on numbers, including unknown numbers, as they may be a teacher. If you have any questions, please reach out to your child’s teacher, principal, or if it’s technology-related, call our Technology HELP Desk at 979-209-1175. They are answering calls 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. If they’re unable to answer, leave a message and they will get back in touch with you.
Aside from Schoology, I have some other announcements I need to update you on. Bryan ISD will be closed on Good Friday, April 10. This was a previously scheduled closure, and Bryan ISD is going to honor this day off for employees, many of whom have been working long hours even during the closure.
Here’s what this means for you:

ul.li: There will be no “Grab and Go” meals on Friday, April 10.
Calls to the Technology HELP Desk on Friday, April 10 will be returned beginning Monday, April 13.

div.div:
Additionally, beginning Monday, April 13, the “Grab and Go” meal schedule will change. Meals will be distributed on Monday and Thursday only. However, on Monday families will receive three days of meals, and on Thursday families will receive two days of meals. These will include next-day lunches you can easily warm up along with the same next day breakfasts. Meals will continue to be distributed from all five sites, from 11 a.m. - 1 p.m., and you must have your children in the car. You can find more information on our “Grab and Go” meal webpage.
The reduction in days is being initiated for the health and safety of both Bryan ISD families and school nutrition workers. As the number of COVID-19 cases in Brazos County continues to increase, this will limit the amount of time everyone needs to be outside of their homes.
Thank you for your understanding as Bryan ISD makes decisions in the best interest of your health and the health of our employees. Wishing each of you the very best during this unprecedented time.
Sincerely,
div.p:
Dr. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendent
---
Español
Estimados Padres/Estudiantes del Distrito de Bryan:
Espero que el primer día de aprendizaje en línea con Schoology haya marchado bien. Esto es nuevo para todos nosotros, y habrá algunos obstáculos está semana y posteriormente. Pero, esta es la mejor manera de asegurarnos que nuestros estudiantes sigan trabajando con sus maestros, y recibiendo una excelente educación, incluso cuando se mantengan alejados del plantel escolar. Si tienen una foto bonita de su hijo aprendiendo en casa, por favor envíenla por correo electrónico a info@bryanisd.org. Nos encantaría capturar cómo se están adaptando nuestros increíbles estudiantes.
Aunque estas asignaciones son obligatorias y serán calificadas, algo que estamos adaptando en el Distrito de Bryan es “la comprensión antes de dar una calificación.” Sabemos que la situación de cada uno es diferente, y que la situación de nadie es perfecta. Por eso los estudiantes pueden trabajar en estas asignaciones en cualquier momento de la semana, y sólo necesitan entregarlas al final de cada semana. Si los estudiantes tienen alguna pregunta, por favor, asegúrense de comunicarse con sus maestros a través de Schoology durante las “horas de oficina” del maestro. Puede que los maestros se pongan en contacto con las familias así que no cuelguen las llamadas, incluyendo los números desconocidos, ya que pudiera ser un maestro. Si tienen alguna pregunta, por favor comuníquense con el maestro de su hijo, director o si es algo relacionado con la tecnología, llame al Servicio de Asistencia Técnica al 979-209-1175. Ellos están contestando llamadas de 8:30 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., de lunes a viernes. Si no pueden contestar dejen un mensaje y se pondrán en contacto con ustedes.
Aparte de Schoology, tengo otros anuncios en los que necesito ponerlos al corriente. El Distrito de Bryan permanecerá cerrado el Viernes Santo, 10 de abril. Este era un cierre programado previamente, y el Distrito de Bryan va a honrar este día para los empleados, muchos de los cuales han estado trabajando largas horas aún durante este cierre escolar. Esto es lo que significa para ustedes:

ul.li: No habrá servicio de “Recibir y Llevar” comidas el viernes, 10 de abril.
Las llamadas al Servicio de Asistencia Técnica recibidas el 10 de abril se regresarán a partir del lunes, 13 de abril.

p.br:
Además, a partir del lunes, 13 de abril, el horario de “Recibir y Llevar” comidas cambiará.. Las comidas se distribuirán el lunes y el jueves solamente. Por lo tanto, el lunes las familias recibirán comidas para tres días, y el jueves recibirán comidas para dos días . Estas incluyen almuerzos para el siguiente día que calentarán fácilmente. Las comidas seguirán siendo distribuidas en los cinco sitios, de 11 a.m. - 1 p.m., y deben llevar a sus hijos en el auto. Pueden encontrar más información en nuestra página web de "Recibir y Llevar" comidas.
Se ha iniciado la reducción de días por la salud y seguridad tanto de nuestras familias del Distrito de Bryan como de los trabajadores de nutrición. Como el número de casos de COVID-19 en el Condado de Brazos continúa aumentando, esto limitará la cantidad de tiempo que cada uno necesita estar fuera de sus hogares.
Gracias por su comprensión ya que el Distrito de Bryan toma decisiones en el mejor interés de su salud y la de nuestros empleados. Deseándoles a cada uno de ustedes lo mejor durante este tiempo sin precedentes.
Sinceramente,
Dra. Christie Whitbeck
Superintendente del Distrito de Bryan

div.p:
Dear Bryan ISD Parent/Guardians,
Now that the closure of our campuses has been extended until at May 4, at the earliest, it is necessary to transition into the next phase of our At- Home Instructional Plan.
First, I want to thank you for embracing Bryan ISD’s first phase of optional learning at home. I’ve seen many pictures and videos of our students actively involved in education, and I’m hearing very positive stories from our teachers and principals.
Beginning Monday, April 6, we will begin Phase 2 of the Bryan ISD At Home Instruction Plan teaching all classes through a program called Schoology. Here’s what this means for you:

ul.li: One Login: All students will access all of their classes by going to go.bryanisd.org, clicking on the Schoology App, and logging in using their Bryan ISD student login. All of their lessons from every class including messages from their teachers will be right there when they log in. Students simply click on the lesson and complete the assignment. Click HERE to watch a video about how to log in, access your classes, and complete your assignments.

Weekly Lessons: Learning through Schoology will be similar to learning at school, except teachers will upload lessons for the entire week. We encourage students to log into their Schoology account every day and complete that day’s lessons and activities. The student must complete all the lessons by the end of the week. Students can ask their teachers questions through Schoology, and if you have questions for your child’s teacher, you can message them through Schoology, too.

Graded Assignments: As we enter the 6th Six Weeks, Bryan ISD will start grading assignments completed through Schoology. We want to make sure Bryan ISD students continue to move forward with their education, even as our buildings are closed. Lessons in Schoology will mimic those in the classroom, but students can complete them each day at the time most convenient for them. This will allow families with multiple children to share one Chromebook, and still complete all the lessons.

div.p:
Please click HERE to look at the entire Bryan ISD Instructional Plan for At-Home Learning, created for Bryan ISD teachers. It will be very important for you to make sure your children log in and complete these lessons just as if they were in school.
Now, I know you may have some questions, as this is going to be a new experience for all of us.

ul.li: How will grades be calculated? The calculation of grades for the 5th Six Weeks and 6th Six Weeks depends on your child’s grade level. Click HERE to review our grading guidelines and procedures for both the 5th and 6th Six Weeks.

What if I don’t have a computer at home? Bryan ISD has been and will continue distributing Chromebook laptops to families based on their responses to the Bryan ISD Technology Survey. Please click HERE to fill out the survey if you haven’t done so previously.

What if I can’t connect to the internet? There are a number of options for connecting to the internet, many at no cost for families. SuddenLink is offering free internet for people living in their coverage area. Many cell phone carriers are waiving data limits which allow you to turn your phone into a WiFi hotspot at no extra charge. Bryan ISD has also boosted the WiFi signal at all of our campuses and facilities so families can come to the campus and access WiFi for free outside. Because education is essential, this is allowed under the shelter in place order. Click HERE for more information about internet options available during this closure.

What about paper packets? We would prefer for you to access work over the internet. This is due to our concern about the health safety of our staff and your family. The virus can live on paper, and every time you leave to pick up or drop off paperwork, you could put yourself, your children or Bryan ISD staff at risk. Also, with paper packets, students lose interaction with their teachers. The teacher is a critical component of excellent learning, and any students using paper will not have as strong of a learning experience as those interacting with their teacher through Schoology. After viewing the lesson, independent assignments can be printed from the online platform if paper and pencil is still preferred. Teachers will work with families to receive the completed assignment through pictures, text, email, etc. Your willingness to work within the system is greatly appreciated.

div.p:
Please remember, we are here to help with any questions you have. If your question is about a lesson or assignment, please contact your child’s teacher through Schoology. If it is about connecting to the internet and technology, please call our Technology HELP Desk at 979-209-1175 or email BISD_Helpdesk@BryanISD.org.
We are working very hard for this to run as smoothly as possible, but we know there will be some bumps, too. Thank you for patience, and for sharing with us the goal of making sure all Bryan ISD students continue to receive an excellent education and finish out the school year strong, whether it's in school or from home. Please remember, if we stand apart as a community now, we will be together again soon.
Dr. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendent

strong.span: ¿Qué pasa si no puedo conectarme a internet?

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Existen varias opciones para conectarse a Internet, muchas sin costo para las familias. SuddenLink ofrece internet gratis para las personas que viven en su área de cobertura. Muchos operadores telefónicos de celular están renunciando a los límites de datos que le permiten convertir su teléfono en un punto de acceso WiFi sin costo adicional. Bryan ISD también ha aumentado la señal WiFi en todas nuestras escuelas e instalaciones para que familias puedan venir a la escuela y acceder a WiFi de forma gratuita. Debido a que la educación es esencial, esto está permitido bajo la orden de refugio en casa. Haga clic

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: para obtener más información sobre las opciones de Internet disponibles durante este cierre.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Preferiríamos que inicien el trabajo a través de Internet. Esto se debe a nuestra preocupación por la seguridad de la salud de nuestro personal y su familia. El virus puede vivir en el papel, y cada vez que salga a recoger o dejar papeleo, podría ponerse en riesgo usted, sus hijos o el personal de Bryan ISD.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Además, con los paquetes de papel, los estudiantes pierden la interacción con sus maestros. El maestro es un componente crítico de un excelente aprendizaje, y cualquier estudiante que use papel no tendrá una experiencia de aprendizaje tan sólida como la de aquellos que interactúan con su maestro a través de Schoology. Después de ver la lección, se pueden imprimir tareas independientes desde la plataforma en línea si todavía se prefiere papel y lápiz. Los maestros trabajarán con las familias para recibir la tarea completada a través de imágenes, texto, correo electrónico, etc. Se agradece mucho su disposición a trabajar dentro del sistema.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Por favor, recuerden, estamos aquí para ayudar con cualquier pregunta que tengan. Si su pregunta es sobre una lección o tarea, comuníquense con el maestro de su hijo a través de Schoology. Si se trata de conectarse a Internet y a la tecnología, llamen a nuestro mostrador de ayuda tecnológica al 979-209-1175 o envíen un correo electrónico.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Estamos trabajando con gran esfuerzo para que esto funcione lo mejor posible, pero sabemos que también habrá algunos obstáculos. Gracias por su paciencia y por compartir con nosotros el objetivo de asegurarnos de que todos los estudiantes de Bryan ISD continúen recibiendo una excelente educación y terminen el año escolar, ya sea en la escuela o desde casa. Recuerden que si nos separamos como comunidad ahora, estaremos juntos nuevamente pronto.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dra. Christie Whitbeck

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Superintendente de Bryan ISD

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dear Bryan ISD Parents/Guardians,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: As we all work together to stop the spread of COVID-19, Bryan ISD schools will remain closed through Friday, May 1, making the earliest possible restart Monday, May 4, 2020. This extended closure mandate comes from Governor Abbott, who issued an executive order today stating that Texans should only be in public for essential reasons, such as buying food, and even then need to continue to observe social distancing.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I agree with Governor Abbott’s decision and believe this is the right step towards ensuring our students, staff, and families are safe. As I have stated in previous letters, just because our campuses are closed does not mean learning has stopped. I have been so encouraged by all of the learning I’ve seen from our students and the positive messages from principals and teachers about the virtual interactions that are taking place.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: In anticipation of continued closure, BISD leadership has been busy developing Phase 2 of our Instructional Learning Plan. Starting Monday, April 6, 2020, all students will be interacting with their teachers through a program called Schoology, available through ClassLink at

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: . I’ll send a more detailed letter with information about this plan tomorrow (Wednesday), but I’d like you to take the rest of the week to make sure you have a computer at home and the ability to access the internet. We’ve handed out thousands of Chromebook laptops, but if you have not received one yet,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: please take our online technology survey by clicking HERE.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If you are unable to connect to the internet,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: please click HERE to see a number of options for free internet.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: It is very important that our students are connected with their teachers to make sure they are receiving the best education possible during this closure. To accomplish this, they must engage online, for the optimum safety of our staff and children.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: Our grab and go lunch/breakfast will also continue.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: You can continue to pick up a grab and go lunch/breakfast from Monday - Friday, 11 a.m. - 1 p.m. at Bryan High School, Long Intermediate School, Kemp-Carver Elementary School, Jones Elementary School, and Navarro Elementary School. Per the Texas Department of Agriculture guidelines, you must have your children with you in the car. For safety, some practices at the site may change to keep social distance and to assure safety, so stay tuned.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: I’m excited to share more about Phase 2 of online learning tomorrow (Wednesday), but today I thought it was important to focus on the extended closure and abiding by this new executive order from Governor Abbott. We are all doing our part together to stop the spread of COVID-19, and get life back to normal as soon as possible. Thank you for being a partner in this for Bryan, the Brazos Valley and the State of Texas. I appreciate your partnership.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dr. Christie Whitbeck

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Bryan ISD Supterintendent

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

div.p: Estimados padres del Distrito Escolar de Bryan:

Mientras trabajamos unidos para detener la propagación del COVID-10, las escuelas en el Distrito Escolar de Bryan continuarán cerradas hasta el viernes, 1o de mayo, haciendo que el lunes, 4 de mayo de 2020 sea el comienzo más temprano posible de clases. La clausura extendida ha sido exigida por el Gobernador Abbott, quien dio esta orden ejecutiva el día de hoy pidiendo que todas las personas en Texas sólo deben estar en lugares públicos por razones necesarias y esenciales, tales como para comprar comida, y aun asi deben mantener el distanciamiento social.

Estoy de acuerdo con la decisión del Gobernador Abbott y creo que esta es la forma correcta de asegurar que nuestros estudiantes, personal, y familias estén seguros. Como he expresado en cartas anteriores, sólo porque nuestras escuelas están cerradas no quiere decir que la enseñanza se ha detenido. Estoy muy entusiasmada con todo el aprendizaje que he visto en nuestros estudiantes y los mensajes positivos de los directores y maestros acerca de las oportunidades de interacción virtuales que se están llevando a cabo.

En anticipación al continuo cierre, el liderazgo de BISD ha desarrollado la Fase 2 de nuestro Plan de Aprendizaje de Instrucción. A partir del lunes 6 de abril de 2020, todos los estudiantes interactuaran con sus maestros a través de un programa llamado Schoology, disponible a través de ClassLink en go.bryanisd.org. Enviaré una carta más detallada con información sobre este plan mañana (miércoles), pero me gustaría que tomen el resto de la semana para asegurarse que cuentan con una computadora en casa, y la posibilidad de acceder a internet. Hemos repartido miles de Chromebooks portátiles, pero si aún no han recibido una, tomen nuestra encuesta sobre tecnología en línea haciendo clic AQUÍ. Si no puede conectarse a internet, por favor haga clic AQUÍ para ver un número de opciones para internet gratuito). Es muy importante que nuestros estudiantes estén conectados con sus maestros para asegurarse que están recibiendo la mejor educación posible durante este cierre. Para lograr esto, deben participar en línea, para la seguridad óptima de nuestro personal y los niños.

Nuestro almuerzo y desayuno para llevar también continuará. Pueden seguir recogiendo un almuerzo y desayuno de lunes a viernes, de 11 a.m. - 1 p.m. en la Preparatoria Bryan, Escuela Intermedia Long, Escuela Primaria Kemp-Carver, Escuela Primaria Jones y Escuela Primaria Navarro. Según las pautas del Departamento de Agricultura de Texas, debe llevar a sus hijos en el auto con usted. Por seguridad, algunas prácticas en el sitio pueden cambiar para mantener la distancia social.

Estoy ansiosa por compartir la Fase 2 del Aprendizaje en Línea mañana, miércoles, pero creo que hoy era importante enfocarnos en la clausura extendida y seguir esta orden ejecutiva del gobernador Abbott. Todos estamos haciendo nuestra parte juntos para detener la propagación del COVID-19, y para que la vida vuelva a la normalidad lo antes posible. Gracias por ser nuestros socios en esta situación para Bryan, el Condado de Brazos, y el estado de Texas. Agradezco su colaboración.

Dra. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendente

span.span: to do so as soon as possible. If you have any other questions or need help taking the survey, please call our Technology HELP Desk at 979-209-1175. Only after you’ve taken the survey will a member of our technology team call you with information about picking up a Chromebook. Even with the shelter in place, education is essential, so you will still be able to pick up a Chromebook.

ul.li: Instruction - It is more important than ever that children continue learning during this closure. The best way for this to happen is to use the Bryan ISD Online and Offline Learning Activities. Click HERE to access these enrichment and review activities that are grade-appropriate and include options with and without technology. Our team is working on a plan to allow students to interact with their teachers through a system called Schoology. Training for our teachers is beginning this week, but many are already using quality platforms such as Zoom, Google Hangout, Class Dojo, etc. It’s also important that your child has regular activity while they’re at home. Please look to the Bryan ISD Facebook, Twitter and Instagram pages for fun activities that will get your child up and active at home. Additionally, expect lessons on our Essential 8 Character trait initiative to be added tomorrow. There is no better time to discuss courage (March trait) than now.

Nutrition - During the shelter in place, “grab and go” lunch and breakfast will continue. Families can stop by Jones Elementary School, Bryan High School, Long Intermediate School, and Kemp-Carver Elementary School Monday through Friday, 11 a.m. - 1 p.m. to pick up a “grab and go” lunch and breakfast. You must have your child with you. Beginning Monday, March 30, we will add Navarro Elementary to the list and meals will be available there at the same time.

Communication - Please click HERE to log into your Home Access Center account and make sure all of your information including your phone number and email are correct. This is very important so you don’t miss an important message. Please also look at your settings indicating whether you want to receive emails or text messages. Make sure those boxes are checked. Please also regularly check www.bryanisd.org/covid19 for updated information.

p.span: Our main goal remains the health safety of our students, staff, and community, along with ensuring our students do not fall behind on learning. As we have new information, I will continue to share it with you. Please continue to take care of yourself and your children.

p.span: Bryan ISD Superintendente

p.strong: Dr. Whitbeck - Message to the Class of 2020

div.p: Dear Bryan ISD Class of 2020,
I’ve been sending a lot of messages to parents, Bryan ISD staff and the community over the last week, but I wanted to take a moment to write to you personally.

Eight more weeks of school. After close to 13 years of your life in school, you are down to only eight weeks and a situation unlike any other we’ve experienced has come out of nowhere to disrupt your plans.

You are a special group of students. Many of you were born shortly after 9/11/2001, so you came into this world during a unique time of both uncertainty and togetherness for our country and the world. Now, as you prepare to graduate from high school, our country and world are in a similar situation. This tells me your class can withstand difficult times and are surely destined to do great things!

Myself, your principals, teachers and the staff you see every day at school, all feel for you. This is supposed to be a time of celebration, and it’s being cut short. Activities, competitions, events, are all being canceled right now, and instead of focusing on this special time together, the focus has shifted to staying apart from each other. We hate that this is happening to you.

Right now, Bryan ISD is still planning to resume classes on April 6. But, with the number of COVID-19 cases still rising in Brazos County and in Texas, this is very tentative. The reality is this societal shut-down may stretch on longer. With that in mind, it’s important for you to know we will do everything possible to make these last few weeks and your graduation as special as we possibly can. For all your hard work, you deserve nothing less.

How that looks, I can’t say right now because the situation is constantly changing. As of today, your graduation ceremonies will continue as planned. In the meantime, I have granted permission for Balfour to contact you and allow you to pick up your cap and gown in a drive up and go format. Be expecting to hear from someone about the details. I have also asked the high school principals for the names and contact info for all senior class officers. I will schedule a Google hangout with them early next week. Please let your school’s senior officers know what your major concerns are and how we can most help you. I will be asking your class leaders for feedback.

You’re going to receive a lot of information over the next few days about online instruction through the beginning of April and even longer if necessary. Please do not take this lightly. Finish the year strong, proudly receive your Bryan ISD diploma, and know we support you and couldn’t be more proud of your accomplishments. Take care and I will be in touch.

Dr. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendent
Dear Bryan ISD Parents,

A lot has happened this week, both in our community and in the school district. The situation surrounding COVID-19 is rapidly changing, and we’ve been working on a plan to educate your children over the next two weeks while Bryan ISD remains closed, and longer if necessary.

ul.li: Instruction: Bryan ISD will begin using a learning management system called Schoology. This system will allow teachers to share lessons with students, and for students to complete work and “turn it in” similar to actually being in a classroom. Our team is working on lessons right now, and we plan to focus on the core subject areas first. While still in development, when we have more information about when this will start I will let you know.

Technology: We are currently distributing Chromebooks to families who do not have a computer at home. If you have not filled out this Technology Survey, please do so. It is through this survey that families are being contacted about checking out a Chromebook. If you need help completing the survey or simply want to tell us, please call our Technology HELP Desk at 979-209-1175. It is staffed from 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. Monday through Friday. I know connecting to the internet is an obstacle for some. If you live in an area served by SuddenLink, please look into this offer of free internet. If not, we are also putting together a map where there is WiFi available, including in our school parking lots. I know this is not the most convenient option, because it would mean driving to a site and staying in your car while you’re connected, but it would be an option. Many cell phone providers are also waiving data limits, so parents and students could connect through their phones without using WiFi. Please contact your cell phone provider for more information, because it varies by carrier.

Nutrition: We are now providing both breakfast and lunch at our food distribution sites. On Monday, we will have some changes to our locations. We will open a new site at Jones Elementary School (1400 Pecan St) but will close our site at Rayburn Intermediate School. Food will still be distributed at Bryan High School, Long Intermediate School, and Kemp-Carver Elementary School. All of these sites will continue to open from 11 a.m. - 1 p.m., Monday through Friday. You must have your children with you to receive breakfast and lunch.

br.p: Right now, Bryan ISD is still planning to resume classes on April 6. However, with the number of COVID-19 cases still rising in Brazos County and in Texas, this is very tentative. The reality is this societal shut-down may stretch on longer. If that happens, we are preparing to continue educating our students so they receive ongoing instruction and do not fall behind.

Thank you for your patience and support during this unprecedented situation. If there is one piece of good that comes from COVID-19, I hope it’s a greater respect for teachers and educators and what they do every day for the students they serve. We are very blessed in Bryan ISD to employ some of the most dedicated people I have ever known. I will continue providing you updated information as I know it. Take care of yourself and your precious children.

Dr. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 10pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

br.p: Estimados padres del distrito escolar de Bryan,

Mucho acontecimientos han sucedido esta semana, tanto en nuestra comunidad como en el distrito escolar. La situación rodeando el COVID-19 cambia rápidamente y estamos trabajando en un plan para educar a sus niños durante las siguientes dos semanas mientras el distrito escolar de Bryan permanece cerrado, y por más tiempo de ser necesario.

ul.li: Instrucción académica: El distrito escolar de Bryan empezará un sistema de manejo de enseñanza llamado Schoology. El sistema permite que los maestros compartan lecciones con los estudiantes, y que los estudiantes completen su trabajo y lo devuelvan a los maestros del tal forma que simula un salón de clases. Nuestro equipo está trabajando en estos momentos y estamos enfocados en las materias básicas primeramente. El proceso está aún en desarrollo y en cuanto tengamos más información sobre cuándo estará listo se los comunicaré a ustedes.

Tecnología: Estamos actualmente distribuyendo tabletas Chromebooks a las familias que no tienen una computadora en casa. Si usted no ha completado esta encuesta todavía, le pedimos lo haga lo antes posible. Es a través de esta encuesta que nos estamos comunicando con las familias para que puedan pasar por la tableta Chromebook. Si usted tiene dificultad completando la encuesta o simplemente quiere decirnos por favor llame a la línea de ayuda del Departamento de Tecnología,al 979-209-1175, donde habrá personal para contestar las llamadas de 8:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m. de lunes a viernes. Entiendo que para algunos poderse conectar al internet representa un obstáculo. Si usted vive en un área donde SuddenLink ofrece servicios debe leer esta oferta para servicios gratuitos . También estamos desarrollando un mapa indicando donde hay servicio WiFi disponible, incluyendo los estacionamientos de nuestras escuelas. Reconocemos que esta no es la opción más conveniente, ya que implica manejar y llegar al lugar y quedarse en el carro mientras esta conectado, pero sigue siendo una opción. Muchas compañías de teléfonos celulares están dando datos ilimitados, así que los padres y los estudiantes pueden conectarse por medio de sus teléfonos celulares sin necesidad de usar WiFi. Por favor comuníquese con su proveedor de teléfono celular para obtener más información al respecto, porque varía según la compañía telefónica.

Nutrición: Por el momento estamos ofreciendo el desayuno y el almuerzo en nuestros sitios de distribución. El lunes, tendremos algunos cambios a nuestros sitios. Abriremos un sitio nuevo en la Primaria Jones (1400 Pecan St) pero cerraremos el sitio de la Escuela Intermedia Rayburn. La comida todavía se distribuirá en la Preparatoria Bryan, en la Escuela Intermedia Long y en la Escuela Primaria Kemp-Carver. Todos estos sitios continuarán abriendo de 11 a.m. - 1 p.m., de lunes a viernes. Deben de llevar a los niños con ustedes para recibir el desayuno y el almuerzo.

br.p: En este momento Bryan ISD todavía sigue planeando reanudar las clases el 6 de abril. Sin embargo, el número de casos de COVID-19 están en aumento en el condado de Brazos y en Texas, esto es muy tentativo. La realidad es que este cierre total puede extenderse por más tiempo. Si eso sucede nos preparamos para continuar educando a nuestros estudiantes para que reciban una instrucción continúa y no se retrasen.

Gracias por su paciencia y apoyo durante esta situación sin precedentes. Si hay algo que hemos aprendido de COVID-19, espero que sea un mayor respeto por los maestros educadores y lo que hacen cada día por los estudiantes a quienes prestan servicios. Estamos muy bendecidos en Bryan ISD de emplear a las personas más dedicadas que he conocido. Continuaré proporcionándoles información actualizada conforme tenga conocimiento. Cuidense mucho y a sus preciosos hijos.

Dra. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendente

p.span: With the best interest of our students, staff, and community in mind, Bryan ISD will remain closed until April 3, 2020.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This decision comes after consultation with the Brazos County Health Department, following the first identified case of COVID-19 locally. We know this decision will greatly impact our families, but please know we are taking action based on guidance from our local and state health leaders with the shared goal of community health safety.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: While our buildings are closed, this does not mean education is coming to a halt. Within the next few days, Bryan ISD will share information on how we will continue to educate our students at home. There are a lot of moving pieces to make this happen, but we are already working on the best strategy so all of our students continue to receive instruction.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Also, our free “grab and go lunch” will continue Monday - Friday while Bryan ISD is closed. You may continue to pick up lunch from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Bryan High School, Long Intermediate, Rayburn Intermediate, and Kemp-Carver Elementary School. Families may choose any of these four locations, but because of federal guidelines, you must have your children with you to receive the “grab and go lunch.” We are working on expanding locations, but are awaiting Texas Department of Agriculture approval.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Please continue to refer to our Bryan ISD COVID-19 update page,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: underline; -webkit-text-decoration-skip: none; text-decoration-skip-ink: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: for updated information including a list of sites for learning, games, and activities for students that will be uploaded later today.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: One of our greatest strengths is our community. Together, we will get through this new and ever-changing challenge. While much remains in motion right now, we will continue working diligently to make decisions in the best interest of our students, staff, and community, and we will keep you updated every step of the way.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Thank you for your support during this time.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dr. Christie Whitbeck

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Bryan ISD Superintendent

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 400; font-variant: normal; text-decoration: none; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Estimados padres / tutores de Bryan ISD: Con el mejor interés de nuestros estudiantes, el personal y la comunidad en mente, Bryan ISD permanecerá cerrado hasta el 3 de abril de 2020.

Esta decisión se produce después de consultar con el Departamento de Salud del Condado de Brazos, luego del primer caso identificado de COVID-19 localmente. Sabemos que esta decisión tendrá un gran impacto en nuestras familias, pero tenga en cuenta que estamos tomando medidas basadas en la orientación de nuestros líderes de salud locales y estatales con el objetivo compartido de la seguridad de la salud comunitaria.

li.span: Si bien nuestros edificios están cerrados, esto no significa que la educación se esté deteniendo. En los próximos días, Bryan ISD compartirá información sobre cómo continuaremos educando a nuestros estudiantes en casa. Hay muchas piezas en movimiento para que esto suceda, pero ya estamos trabajando en la mejor estrategia para que todos nuestros estudiantes continúen recibiendo instrucción.

Además, nuestro "almuerzo para llevar" continuará de lunes a viernes, mientras que Bryan ISD está cerrado. Puede continuar recogiendo el almuerzo de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m. en Bryan High School, Long Intermediate, Rayburn Intermediate y Kemp-Carver Elementary School. Las familias pueden elegir cualquiera de estos cuatro lugares, pero debido a las pautas federales, debe tener a sus hijos con usted para recibir el "almuerzo para llevar". Estamos trabajando para expandir las ubicaciones, pero estamos esperando la aprobación del Departamento de Agricultura de Texas.

Continúe consultando nuestra página de actualización de Bryan ISD COVID-19, www.bryanisd.org/covid19 para obtener información actualizada que incluye una lista de sitios de aprendizaje, juegos y actividades para estudiantes que se cargarán más tarde hoy.

p.span: Una de nuestras mayores fortalezas es nuestra comunidad. Juntos, superaremos este desafío nuevo y siempre cambiante. Si bien hay muchas cosas en movimiento en este momento, continuaremos trabajando diligentemente para tomar decisiones en el mejor interés de nuestros estudiantes, el personal y la comunidad, y lo mantendremos actualizado en cada paso del camino. Gracias por su apoyo durante este tiempo.
Dr. Christie Whitbeck
Superintendente de Bryan ISD

div.p:
Based on the continued spread of the COVID-19 or Coronavirus, all Bryan ISD campuses will be closed at least one week from March 16-20, 2020. All school events will also be canceled during this time. While there are currently no reported cases of the virus in the Brazos Valley, this proactive decision was made considering our connectedness with Texas A&M University and Blinn College who also have students returning from Spring Break.
A no-cost “grab and go lunch” will be available for all Bryan ISD students from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. March 16-20 at Bryan High School, Long Intermediate, Rayburn Intermediate and Kemp-Carver Elementary School. Families may choose any of these four locations.
Please continue to keep general health precautions in mind, including washing your hands and precautions outlined by the Texas Department of State Health Services: dshs.state.tx.us/coronavirus.
We will continue to monitor the spread of the virus and will keep you updated when more information is available. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we make these decisions in the best interest of our students and staff.
Sincerely,
Dr. Christie Whitbeck
--
Basado en la propagación continua de COVID-19 o Coronavirus, todos los campus de Bryan ISD permanecerán cerrados al menos una semana del 16 al 20 de marzo de 2020.
Todos los eventos escolares también se cancelarán durante este tiempo. Si bien actualmente no hay casos reportados del virus en el Valle de Brazos, esta decisión proactiva se tomó teniendo en cuenta nuestra conexión con Texas A&M University y Blinn College, que también tienen estudiantes que regresan de las vacaciones de primavera. Habrá un "almuerzo para llevar" sin costo para todos los estudiantes de Bryan ISD de 11 a.m. a 1 p.m. 16-20 de marzo en Bryan High School, Long Intermediate, Rayburn Intermediate y Kemp-Carver Elementary School. Las familias pueden elegir cualquiera de estos cuatro lugares.
Siga teniendo en cuenta las precauciones generales de salud, incluido el lavado de manos y las precauciones descritas por el Departamento de Servicios de Salud del Estado de Texas: dshs.state.tx.us/coronavirus. Continuaremos monitoreando la propagación del virus y lo mantendremos actualizado cuando haya más información disponible. Apreciamos su paciencia y comprensión mientras tomamos estas decisiones en el mejor interés de nuestros estudiantes y personal.
Sinceramente, Dr. Christie Whitbeck

br.p: I know there has been a lot of attention on social media and in the news media recently about COVID-19, a type of coronavirus, which I’m sure is leading to many questions from your child. I want to make sure you have the most accurate information so you can answer those questions properly.

COVID-19 is not a threat in our area right now. However, it is important for you to know that Bryan ISD is in contact with the Brazos County Health District, and we take direction from them about the health and safety of our community. We also participated in a conference call with the Texas Department of State Health Services that was specifically for school districts. They said the best precautions for COVID-19 are the same as any other airborne illness, such as Influenza. Please encourage your children to wash their hands regularly with soap and water, avoid touching their eyes, nose or mouth, and cover their mouth and nose with a tissue, their sleeve, or their elbow anytime they cough or sneeze and to not share food while at lunch. While these suggestions seem simple, they are the best protection against airborne illnesses.

Bryan ISD also takes many precautions this time of year to prevent the spread of illness. Our campuses and facilities are cleaned daily by our custodians and additional disinfecting can occur in any classroom where sickness of any kind is more prevalent. We also use disinfectant on our school buses weekly and our special education buses nightly. But, prevention actually begins at home. If your child is feeling sick, please do not send them to school. (Middle School and High School students seeking final exam exemptions, see FAQ.)

Finally, while there’s so much attention about COVID-19, please speak with your child about staying calm and not panicking. Despite what is going around social media right now, they do not need to be scared. There are many level-headed smart adults (mainly you) that will help us through the challenge if need be. The Health Department is the authority in our area on this and any other illness, and should we receive any information from them, we will pass it along to you immediately. We genuinely care about our children and staff and will continue to put safety, including health safety, first.
I hope you have a safe and enjoyable Spring Break, and if you are traveling, keep these general health precautions in mind.

Sincerely,
Dr. Christie Whitbeck
Bryan ISD Superintendent
For more information about COVID-19 and precautions, please click on this link to be taken to the Texas Department of State Health Services:https://www.dshs.state.tx.us/coronavirus
br.span: For more information please read the Bryan ISD Health Safety FAQ.

div.p: Estimados Padres/Tutores de Estudiantes en Bryan ISD:

Tengo conocimiento que recientemente se ha prestado mucha atención en las redes sociales y en los medios de comunicación sobre COVID-19, mejor conocido como el Coronavirus, que estoy seguro está generando muchas preguntas de su hijo. Quiero asegurarme de que tenga la información más precisa para que pueda responder esas preguntas correctamente.

COVID-19 no es una amenaza en nuestra área en este momento. Sin embargo, es importante que sepan que Bryan ISD está en contacto con el Distrito de Salud del Condado de Brazos, y ellos nos dan instrucciones sobre la salud y la seguridad de nuestra comunidad. También participamos en una conferencia telefónica con el Departamento de Servicios de Salud del Estado de Texas que fue específicamente para distritos escolares. Dijeron que las mejores precauciones para COVID-19 son las mismas que para cualquier otra enfermedad transmitida por el aire, como la influenza. Pídanle a sus hijos que se laven las manos regularmente con agua y jabón, eviten tocarse los ojos, la nariz o la boca, y se cubran la boca y la nariz con un pañuelo de papel, la manga o el codo cada vez que tosan o estornuden y no compartan alimentos durante el almuerzo. Si bien estas sugerencias parecen simples, son la mejor protección contra las enfermedades transmitidas por el aire.

Bryan ISD también toma muchas precauciones en esta época del año para prevenir la propagación de enfermedades. Nuestros conserjes limpian diariamente nuestros planteles escolares e instalaciones y puede llevarse a cabo una desinfección adicional en cualquier salón de clases donde prevalecen enfermedades de cualquier tipo. También usamos desinfectante en nuestros autobuses escolares semanalmente y en nuestros autobuses de educación especial todas las noches. Pero, la prevención en realidad comienza en casa. Si su hijo se siente enfermo, no lo envíe a la escuela. (Los estudiantes de secundaria y preparatoria que buscan exenciones de exámenes finales, consulte las preguntas frecuentes).

Por último, aunque hay tanta atención sobre COVID-19, hable con su hijo sobre mantener la calma y no entrar en pánico. A pesar de lo que está sucediendo en las redes sociales en este momento, no necesitan tener miedo. Hay muchos adultos inteligentes y sensatos (principalmente usted) que nos ayudarán a superar el desafío si es necesario. El Departamento de Salud es la autoridad en nuestra área sobre esta y cualquier otra enfermedad, y si recibimos alguna información de ellos, se la transmitiremos de inmediato. Realmente nos preocupamos por nuestros niños y por nuestro personal y seguiremos poniendo en primer lugar la seguridad, incluida la seguridad de la salud.
Sinceramente,
Dra. Christie Whitbeck
Superintendente de Bryan ISD
Mas información: https://www.dshs.state.tx.us/coronavirus/
